required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Camrelizumab for Injection, Apatinib Mesylate and Tegio for First-line Refractory Patients With Advanced Gastric Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Study on the Efficacy and Safety of Camrelizumab for Injection, Apatinib Mesylate and Tegio for First-line Refractory Patients With Advanced Gastric Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, single-center, single-arm, open-label clinical study, aiming at evaluating the efficacy and safety of camrelizumab for injection, apatinib mesylate and tegio for first-line refractory patients with advanced gastric cancer.

intervention.intervention_name: Camrelizumab for injection, apatinib mesylate and tegio
intervention.description: Camrelizumab for injection: fixed dose of 200 mg, ivgtt for 30 minutes, given on D1, repeat for every 3 weeks; Apatinib mesylate: 250 mg, p.o, qd; Tegio capsule: p.o., bid, D1-14, repeat for every 21 days.
